intro: Duguetia cuspidata, commonly known as the scarlet starling tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy fruits that are edible and contain seeds enclosed in a fibrous pulp. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Duguetia cuspidata plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various wildlife species.
